MajorClaims.MC1: strict laws, like capital punishment, are essential in a society
MajorClaims.MC2: Capital punishment is essential to control violence in the society
MajorClaims.MC3: psychopaths, terrorists or any other criminal who lacks empathy for other human lives deserve capital punishment

Claims.C1: Capital punishment helps to safeguard human rights in a strict and effective manner
Claims.C2: capital punishment protects the society from hardcore criminals
Claims.C3: the rate of crime and violence is effectively decreased
Claims.C4: Criminals who don't have any chance of improvement or who have a past record of such crimes are, therefore, given capital punishment
Claims.C5: They can make mistakes which can sometimes affect an innocent, circumstantially marred criminals

Premises.P1: When a criminal becomes a threat to the society, such that they can commit heinous crimes, then they are given capital punishment
Premises.P2: Capital punishment is given only in the "rarest of the rare" cases
Premises.P3: Its first and foremost objective is safety of other human beings
Premises.P4: capital punishment curbs the inspiration and prospects of other hateful crimes
Premises.P5: When a criminal mind knows the quantum of punishment, they will fear and not commit such crimes
Premises.P6: capital punishment saves a lot of government funding which is wasted in maintenance of these hardcore criminals
Premises.P7: the jury giving the verdict are also humans
Premises.P8: They have the life of a person at their discretion
Premises.P9: The jury must therefore, take into account the circumstances of committing a crime
Premises.P10: if an individual murders someone for self-defense, then such a crime is not heinous
Premises.P11: Only deserving criminals, who commit such hateful crimes in their proper senses are subjected to capital punishment
